results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Writing and Writers;Books and Literature;Amis, Martin;Amis, Kingsley;Hitchens, Christopher;Great Britain
results.title: Martin Amis, Acclaimed Author of Bleakly Comic Novels, Dies at 73
results.abstract: In books like “Money” and “The Information,” he created “a high style to describe low things,” as he put it. He found more renown as a critic, and a measure of unease as his famous father’s son.

media.caption: Martin Amis in 2012. He wrote 15 novels, a memoir and books of nonfiction. He was also known for his swagger, his good looks and his involvements with some of the most watched young women of his era.
media.copyright: Jennifer S. Altman for The New York Times

results.byline: By Liz Alderman and Niki Kitsantonis
results.title: Building Boom on Mykonos Reveals ‘Wretched’ Side of Greece’s Recovery
results.abstract: Investors are eager to cash in on soaring demand for luxury properties, but an attack on an archaeologist investigating building violations brought a darker underbelly to light.

media.caption: Construction overlooking Panormos Beach and the Principote beach club.

results.title: Jamaal Bowman Finds His Voice. Some Republicans Don’t Like the Sound.
results.abstract: The Democratic congressman has made a habit of brashly confronting Republicans like Marjorie Taylor Greene, often in public displays meant to attract attention.

media.caption: Representatives Jamaal Bowman and Marjorie Taylor Greene appeared to be engaging in a good-natured partisan spat, but Ms. Greene said a day later that she had felt threatened.

results.title: Fate Brought Them Together During a Blizzard in Buffalo. Then They Reunited in Seoul.
results.abstract: Months after a South Korean tour group landed at their upstate New York doorstep during a snowstorm, the couple who hosted them received a heroes’ welcome in Seoul.

results.title: There’s No Ocean in Sight. But Many Hawaiians Make Las Vegas Their Home.
results.abstract: The scenery can’t compare. So why are Hawaiians increasingly moving there?

results.title: Why Is Inflation So Stubborn? Cars Are Part of the Answer.
results.abstract: Prices of new and used vehicles were supposed to recede quickly as supply chain problems dissipated. The market had other ideas.

results.title: In a Sharp Reversal, Biden Opens a Path for Ukraine to Get Fighter Jets
results.abstract: The president told allied leaders that he would allow Ukrainian pilots to be trained on American-made F-16s, and is prepared to approve other countries’ transferring the jets to Ukraine.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: President Biden and other leaders at the Peace Memorial Park during a visit as part of the G7 Summit in Hiroshima, Japan, on Friday. He surprised his counterparts by telling them he was prepared to allow some European countries to train Ukrainian pilots on F-16 jets.

results.title: Study Offers New Twist in How the First Humans Evolved
results.abstract: A new genetic analysis of 290 people suggests that humans emerged at various times and places in Africa.

media.caption: Excavations at the Jebel Irhoud archaeological site in Morocco, where 300,000-year-old fossils that may be the oldest evidence of Homo sapiens were found in 2017.
